channel.title: Can't run client
channel.description:
When I try to run my client I get this error:
[code]'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
The code in the run.bat is:
[code]@echo off title Client java -Xmx512m client pause[/code]
Any help?

item.title: Can't run client
item.dc:creator: @Vexillum Vexillum
item.description:
@Vexillum wrote:

Ok I fixed the Environment Variables, thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't run client
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

try

@echo off title Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_02\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m client pause

-by the way wrong section!

Read full topic

item.title: Can't run client
item.dc:creator: @ezzi ezzi
item.description:
@ezzi wrote:

[quote=“Vexillum, post:3, topic:430908”][quote author=ezzi link=topic=533586.msg3900598#msg3900598 date=1327725136]
It has to do with your enviromental variables I believe.
[/quote]

I have JDK 7u2, it is the newest version, and I followed the tutorial in the Server Tutorials section. I have all this setup on my other computer but I just got a new one and it has been over 2 years since I have done this. How come when I download a client to play a server I don’t need Environmental Variables to play it?[/quote]

Tbh I have no clue but i used to get that error then I set my environmental variables, and the server I would download to edit and stuff would work.

Read full topic
